title: To a Lesser Degree; Going in reverseâ€”how can greenhouse gas emissions be removed from the atmosphere?
text:
Nathalie Seddon of the Nature-Based Solutions Initiative explores the ways ecosystems can be enhanced to store carbon. And we go to Iceland to visit the world's largest direct air capture facility that removes carbon from the air, which is then injected into volcanic rock.

Hosted by Vijay Vaitheeswaran, The Economist's global energy and climate innovation editor, with environment editor Catherine Brahic, and Oliver Morton, our briefings editor. Runtime: 32 min
